alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Lowndes; Montgomery; Pike; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike, Bullock, southeastern Lowndes, southern Montgomery, northern Barbour and southern Russell Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Logan to near Ansley to Spring Hill. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Union Springs, Fort Deposit, Midway, Meadville, Pickett, Pine Level, Hawkinsville, Aberfoil, Spring Hill, Dublin, Beans Crossroads, Linwood, Shopton, Grady, Sellers, Davenport, Ramer, Lowndes County Airport, Kent and Strata. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Bullock; Lowndes; Montgomery; Pike; Russell
